basic.description:
A multi-day field trip that uses stratigraphic, sedimentological, and paleontological data to interpret rock successions in a paleoenvironmental and tectonic context.  Enrolment is limited.
NOTE    The course runs during the week that includes Canadian Thanksgiving. Students are responsible for the cost of accommodation and transportation during the trip. Please contact the Department for more information.
basic.subject: GEOL
basic.title: Field Studies in Geology I

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisite    GEOL238.
Corequisite    GEOL321 or GEOL337 or GEOL368.
